body_html: Yes, but I'm wondering if that's the behaviour we want. If a dataset returns a regular Python scalar, it will be concatenated in a tensor, but numpy scalars will be concatenated in tuples/lists. We should probably batch them in a tensor of corresponding type.
body_text: Yes, but I'm wondering if that's the behaviour we want. If a dataset returns a regular Python scalar, it will be concatenated in a tensor, but numpy scalars will be concatenated in tuples/lists. We should probably batch them in a tensor of corresponding type.
body: Yes, but I'm wondering if that's the behaviour we want. If a dataset returns a regular Python scalar, it will be concatenated in a tensor, but numpy scalars will be concatenated in tuples/lists. We should probably batch them in a tensor of corresponding type.
